oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Women walking down the riverbank
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A group of women, wearing long skirts and hats, is walking down a riverbank toward the water. The steamboat "City of Memphis." can be seen ahead docking in the river.

This image provides a distant view of a mule-powered ferry boat next to the river landing. The ferry was attached to a line that ran shore to shore. The mules provided the power for the boat to travel from one side of the shore to the other.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Earl S. Miers River Photograph Collection
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African Americans; Women; Waterfronts; Steamboats; Rivers
